intro: Stachytarpheta cayennensis var. schiedeana, commonly known as the Cayenne stachy, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The flowers are not only visually striking but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
